content.text:
# Draft:Keesan Stewart

Keesan Stewart Earns Jamaica Call-Up and Faces Gibraltar in International Rugby Clash
Bristol, UK – [Date Placeholder for Publication]
Rising rugby talent Keesan Stewart, a dynamic flanker who came through the Bristol Bears Academy, has made waves on the international stage after being selected to represent Jamaica in their fixture against Gibraltar last year.
Stewart’s call-up marked a significant milestone in his sporting journey, reflecting both his athletic progression in the UK and his growing influence within Caribbean rugby. The fixture, which saw Jamaica face off against Gibraltar in an international test, provided the young forward with a valuable opportunity to showcase his physicality, work rate, and tactical understanding at senior level.
Since making his debut, Stewart has continued to train and compete within the Jamaica rugby setup, contributing to the nation’s ambitions to strengthen its presence in the global rugby scene.
“It was an honour to wear the Jamaican colours and represent my heritage on an international stage,” said Stewart. “The experience has motivated me to push even harder and keep developing as a player.”
Known for his relentless energy around the breakdown and his strong defensive game, Stewart’s background with the Bristol Bears Academy has been key in his transition to the international level. Coaches have praised his commitment, discipline, and leadership qualities — traits that have made him a valuable asset both on and off the field.
The Jamaican Rugby Football Union has placed an emphasis on identifying and nurturing players from across the diaspora, aiming to build depth and experience ahead of future competitions. Stewart’s inclusion exemplifies this approach, combining top-level training in the UK with a passion for representing Jamaica on the world stage.
As Jamaica continues to expand its rugby ambitions, athletes like Stewart are proving vital to bridging the gap between domestic development and international success.
